image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Sarah McBride is a biological man': The transgender bathroom row rocking the Capitol
item.description: Following the election of Sarah McBride as the first openly transgender member of Congress, Republican Congresswoman Nancy Mace introduced a bill to bar McBride from using bathrooms aligning with her gender identity within the Capitol. Critics, including McBride, argue that such legislation distracts from pressing issues like healthcare and housing. Mace, once considered a moderate, has shifted rightward after redistricting secured her district for Republicans. This controversy highlights the GOP's focus on cultural issues, with figures like Marjorie Taylor Greene supporting similar measures. Democrats face challenges as Republicans leverage transgender rights debates to energize their base post-2024 elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Matt Gaetz have a son before he married Ginger Luckey?
item.description: Embroiled in controversy, Matt Gaetz, a former congressman facing allegations of sex trafficking, is under scrutiny for his relationship with his adopted son, Nestor. Gaetz, who introduced Nestor to the public in 2020, now faces claims that he used Nestor's PayPal account to pay for sex, further deepening the scandal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cancer, Prince William, and Prince Andrew: Why King Charles is struggling
item.description: Prince William recently sparked controversy with a public critique of royal leadership. In an interview during his trip to South Africa for the Earthshot Prize, the Prince of Wales outlined his vision for a modernized monarchy focused on impact, philanthropy, and collaboration. While William emphasized doing things differently for his generation, the remarks were interpreted as a thinly veiled criticism of his father's approach to governance. His comments, described by some as throwing King Charles "under the bus," highlight growing rifts within the royal family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk reacts to sexual offence allegations against Matt Gaetz: 'Less than...'
item.description: "Matt Gaetz has 3 critical assets that are needed for the AG role: a big brain, a spine of steel and an axe to grind. He is the Judge Dredd America needs to clean up a corrupt system and put powerful bad actors in prison. Gaetz will be our Hammer of Justice," Elon Musk posted on X amid massive backlash over Matt Gaetz as Donald Trump's attorney general pick .
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine fired 6 US-made long-range missiles into Russia, claims Moscow
item.description: Russia claimed Ukraine attacked its Bryansk region with six US-supplied ATACMS missiles, marking their potential first use in the conflict. While Russia stated its air defenses intercepted most missiles, this incident follows the US authorization of ATACMS transfers to Ukraine and Russia's updated nuclear doctrine, escalating tensions between the nations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: DOGE Cuts: Which US Federal employees are most likely to lose their jobs?
item.description: The federal government currently employs about 2.3 million civilian workers, accounting for roughly 0.6% of the US population, according to the White House personnel office. While the workforce has grown by 7% since 2019—largely due to new infrastructure projects funded by the 2022 infrastructure package—it still represents a smaller share of the population compared to historical peaks (e.g., 2% in the 1940s, 1% in the 1960s).
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Morning Joe' hosts' meeting with Trump was 'f**king worth it'; kept as a secret to even bosses
item.description: As 'Morning Joe' hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski drew flak for their meeting with Donald Trump, the show insiders said the meeting was worth it and it would have been a journalistic malptractice to turn down the meeting oppprtunity with the President-elect. They said the meeting was worth it as Trump would now tone down and will acknowledge free media.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I'm Irish': Why meeting King Charles was 'not on list of priorities' for Gladiator 2 star Paul Mescal
item.description: Irish actor Paul Mescal, known for his role in Gladiator 2, shared his underwhelmed response to meeting King Charles III at the film's London premiere. Citing his Irish heritage, Mescal admitted the encounter wasn't a priority. He found it difficult to hear the King over the surrounding noise and resorted to nodding and smiling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK police launch manhunt for Indian-origin man suspected of murdering wife, leaving her body in boot of car and fleeing Britain
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: Is this a video of Donald Trump dancing in the 1970s or 1980s? Here's the truth
item.description: Another one claimed that this was Trump dancing in the 1970s. However, the song playing in the first video of Trump is Blue (Da Ba Dee) came out in 1998. Blue (Da Ba Dee) is a track by the Italian music group Eiffel 65. Initially released in October 1998 in Italy under Skooby Records, the song gained international recognition the following year. It served as the lead single from the group's debut album, Europop, released in 1999. It was memorably used in a scene the Marvel Cinematic Universe, namely in the opening sequence of Iron Man 3. ​​
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why are thousands protesting for Māori rights in New Zealand?
item.description: Tens of thousands of protesters marched in New Zealand's capital on Tuesday, demanding the protection of Māori treaty rights. The demonstration was sparked by a proposed bill that critics say could undermine the Treaty of Waitangi, the country's founding document. Protesters say the bill, which aims to redefine the treaty's principles, could reverse decades of progress in recognizing Māori rights.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Paraguayan President Pena hospitalised during G20 summit
item.description: Paraguayan President Santiago Pena was hospitalized in Rio de Janeiro on Monday due to a "slight indisposition" while attending the G20 summit. He underwent medical checks at Samaritano Hospital, and his office is expected to release a report soon. Vice President Pedro Alliana confirmed speaking with Pena, stating he is doing well.

item.title: Sydney trains set to shut down from November 21-22: All you need to know
item.description: Sydney's train network faces a complete shutdown from Thursday night to Sunday morning as rail workers commence a strike. The Rail Tram and Bus Union (RTBU) initiated the industrial action following unsuccessful negotiations with the New South Wales government regarding pay and conditions. The strike is expected to cause significant disruption for commuters, with limited alternative transport options available.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Scientists discover large underwater volcano off Alaska coast
item.description: Scientists aboard the Coast Guard Cutter Healy have discovered a large underwater volcano approximately 1,600 meters beneath the surface off the coast of Alaska. The team, including experts from NOAA, detected a potential gas plume rising from the volcanic formation. While the discovery is significant, experts believe the volcano poses no immediate threat to nearby ecosystems or human activities due to its considerable depth.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
